item.title: Just In: Twitter Reportedly Planning to Sue Newly Launched Threads
item.dc:creator: Godfrey Benjamin
item.description:
X Corp, the rebranded Twitter parent company, is reportedly planning to sue Mark Zuckerberg’s Meta Platforms Inc over the newly launched social media platform Threads. item.description:

item.title: Elon Musk Successor Shills Twitter, is ‘Threads’ Closing in?

item.description:

item.title: XRPL’s First Evernode Standard Proposal Published, Here’s its Relevance
item.dc:creator: Godfrey Benjamin
item.description:
The XRPL is growing at a sporadic rate as top protocols resident on it are gaining good traction. In one of the most optimistic moves within the XRPL ecosystem, Evernode, one of the network’s Layer-2 protocols has welcomed a newly published standard proposal that may change the functionalities of the scaling solution’s functionality. The Standard

item.title: LUNC News: Terra Luna Classic Staking Hits ATH, Binance CEO “CZ” As Leader, Bitfinex Re-Listing
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
The Terra Luna Classic community moving swiftly on various fronts to revive the Terra Luna Classic ecosystem as well as LUNC and USTC to $1. However, conflicts of interest between developers and groups, low community pool balance, and delisting and lack of support from crypto exchanges are increasing challenges for the blockchain and impacting prices.

The post LUNC News: Terra Luna Classic Staking Hits ATH, Binance CEO “CZ” As Leader, Bitfinex Re-Listing appeared first on CoinGape.
item.content:encoded:
The Terra Luna Classic community moving swiftly on various fronts to revive the Terra Luna Classic ecosystem as well as LUNC and USTC to $1. However, conflicts of interest between developers and groups, low community pool balance, and delisting and lack of support from crypto exchanges are increasing challenges for the blockchain and impacting prices.

The post LUNC News: Terra Luna Classic Staking Hits ATH, Binance CEO “CZ” As Leader, Bitfinex Re-Listing appeared first on CoinGape.

item.title: Binance To Retire Deposit Addresses On BTC, BCH, LTC, XRP, ADA, DOGE Networks
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
The world’s largest crypto exchange Binance to retire selected deposit addresses and memos in batches by networks in Q3. It is part of upgrading its wallet infrastructure to ensure better efficiency and fund security for its users. Some of the top network addresses planned for migration from July to September are Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, XRP,

The post Binance To Retire Deposit Addresses On BTC, BCH, LTC, XRP, ADA, DOGE Networks appeared first on CoinGape.

item.title: Breaking: Shiba Inu’s Shytoshi Kusama Confirms Shibarium And Worldpaper Release Date
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
Shiba Inu’s lead developer Shytoshi Kusama confirms the Shiba Inu ecosystem as the title sponsor of the Blockchain Futurist Conference, and official hackathons ETHToronto and ETHWomen to be held on August 13-17, 2023 in Toronto, Canada. Shytoshi Kusama will also speak for the first time via AI at a conference on the Shibarium release date,

item.title: BlackRock, Fidelity, And Spot Bitcoin ETF Applicants Meeting US SEC: Bloomberg Analysts
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
BlackRock, Fidelity Investments, and other spot Bitcoin ETF filers and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) will hold a meeting next week. The move comes after all spot ETF applicants have refiled their applications with the U.S. SEC, mentioning their surveillance-sharing partners and other required details. Spot Bitcoin ETF Applicants to Meet US SEC

The post BlackRock, Fidelity, And Spot Bitcoin ETF Applicants Meeting US SEC: Bloomberg Analysts appeared first on CoinGape.

item.title: CFTC Concludes Bankrupt Crypto Lender Celsius Broke Rules, Lawsuit Coming?
item.dc:creator: Bhushan Akolkar
item.description:
sources familiar with the matter recently said that investigators at the U.S. Commodities and Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) that bankrupt crypto lender Celsius Network along with its CEO Alex Mashinsky broke regulatory rules before the implosion last year. The sources added that if a majority of the CFTC Commissioners agree to this, the agency could
